review the contact us modal and the button we placed on the Navbar. the button to open the contact us model and the navbar doesn't work
I'll examine the ContactUsModal component and the Navbar to identify why the button isn't working.

content.text:
I found the issue! The problem is with how the `ContactUsModal` component is using `v-model`:

**In ContactUsModal.vue (line 131):**
```vue
const isOpen = defineModel<boolean>("isOpen");
```

**In Navbar.vue (line 11):**
```vue
<ContactUsModal v-if="mounted && props.variant === 'landing'" v-model:isOpen="isContactModalOpen" />
```

The component expects `v-model:isOpen` but `defineModel()` by default creates a `v-model` (without a name). The fix is simple:

content.content:
The file /Users/natedamstra/socialaize/src/components/vue/global/Navbar.vue has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file: 7â†’ 8â†’
9â†’ 10â†’ 11â†’ 12â†’

lines: <nav class="hidden lg:flex items-center gap-6 text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-300 text-base">

content.text:
Fixed! The issue was a mismatch between the v-model binding:

- `defineModel<boolean>("isOpen")` creates a named model that expects `v-model:isOpen`
- `defineModel<boolean>()` creates the default model that expects just `v-model`

Changed both to use the default `v-model` pattern for consistency. The Contact Us button should now properly open the modal.
One isssue with the contact us modal, the submit or whatever button at the bottom text isn't visible
I'll check the button styling in the ContactUsModal to see why the text isn't visible.

I see the issue. In the ContactUsModal, the PrimaryButton is using a slot instead of the `text` prop, but the button component checks `v-if="text"` before rendering. Let me check the exact usage again and fix it:

content.content: The file /Users/natedamstra/socialaize/src/components/vue/buttons/PrimaryButton.vue has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file: 1â†’ 19â†’

content.text: Fixed! The PrimaryButton component was only rendering content when the `text` prop was provided, but the ContactUsModal was using a slot (`<template #default>`) instead. Added `<slot v-else />` to support both patterns - now it will use the `text` prop if provided, otherwise render slot content.
